Summary Heading: Orangeland Is The Place To Be!
Summary: We love this park! We planned our trip very spur of the moment, during the busiest time of year, but we were able to secure one night at this gem of a campground. They squeezed us in knowing how much it meant to us to stay there. It's fantastic!   Not only is the campground clean and well maintained, it's got awesome amenities, and it's only 10 minutes from Disneyland! That is a big draw for us, as most other campgrounds are at least double that for distance and that can mean the difference between a fifteen minute drive and over half an hour!  Trust me, when you want to make rope drop in the morning that is a huge difference!  The park is very aesthetically pleasing and there are citrus fruit trees in every site. The guests are welcome to pick fruit or collect some from the
Room tip: Book early, they are super popular!

Summary: I am giving a 3.5 due to being put in an end back in space, next to the street gate, and full timers next to us encroaching on our space with their crap. Space number 20 while a good size space, and an end space was not what was requested. This is a parking lot type park, and better suited for families leaving for the day to various amusement parks. We came for a two night stay for a sat concert in Irvine and to take a break. This at best would of been an overnight stay. Plus, was check in people were nice and gift shop was cute and well stocked. Raining upon arrival so, didn't get to use pool first day. Understandably, they cater to their money makers the full timers. Also, we had to back down our car at the office, and remove our trailer at space and park it next to us.:(

We stayed here last labor day weekend in 2021. A really great experience from check in to two staff members in a golf cart helping us back our rig into the spot. We were told to pick oranges as that was part of their uniqueness. the pool was fantastic and they really did a great job immediately cleaning ip spots that got vacated and picked up trash at the curb extremely quick.  we rode our bikes around the park and noticed the back row where permanent residents were and it was nice to see that those places were essentially hidden from the grounds up front.   The standards for rvs and trailers they impose is welcoming as we prefer to feel like were not in an Arkansas trailer park. Many rv parks are setting higher standards for physical appearance and mechanical standards of rigs.

This small but incredibly clean and convenient park is among the best RV parks we have stayed at.  The family orientated employees are incredibly knowledgeable and informative.  The location cannot be beat and it's easy to get in and out of, even with a big coach.  This park should be your first look when staying in the area.

We had a great stay in orangeland RV park.  Very clean well organised park with pool, jacuzzi, play area and large laundry room  Close to Disney parks and other attractions.  Fruit trees growing throughout the park freely to pick , just lovely

Summary Heading: Oasis in the middle of the city
Summary: Great stay for four nights at this gem of a park! We were here for a trip to Disneyland and Universal studios. The park is very accessible from I-5 and roughly 3mi from Disneyland. It was a quick 15min drive to the Disneyland parking lot in the mornings. Oranges were ripe while we were there and made a delicious breakfast. The pool offered a nice reprieve from the crowds at Disneyland. We stayed in one of the pull-through, Deluxe RV sites. It wasn’t roomy but we enjoyed having the patio table in the shade.

Orangeland RV park is our 62nd stop and stayed for 28 days. Located just steps away from the Honda Center, and a short distance Anaheim Angels stadium, Interstate 5 and Disneyland, it is very convenient to so much but nicely tucked back from the main road. Some road noise during the day but not bad. The check in process was efficient, they give you a nice welcome package, and we had an excellent guide to help us into our space – the interior roads are a bit tight and we have a 38 foot Class A. The staff are all friendly and work hard to keep the place looking good – celebrating the 50th anniversary. The interior sites are larger than the back in sites along the exterior walls but you are still very close to your neighbors behind you. And the asphalt pads are generally level. The

We chose this place because of the location & amenities. This park was more then we expected. The place is clean, people are friendly and it was really easy to take an OC transit bus to the Disney parks. We just had to walk maybe a block up to the bus stop. And, it was $2 each way. I gave 4 stars because the hot tub was out of commission. The pool was really nice too.

We really enjoyed our short stay here. Our spot was at the end of the row which gave us lots of room to sit outside and also gave us a bit more privacy. The grounds are well kept and as an extra treat, we were able to pick the juiciest Valencia oranges right outside our RV. The park has many, many Valencia orange trees with many oranges ripe and ready to be picked. The bathrooms were well maintained. There is a small store in the main office.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! We are thrilled to hear you had a great time with us. Take care!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights during our return to Disneyland trip. It’s a very nice RV park. We paid extra for a premium spot and it was worth it! We loved having the extra space and a table with chairs to sit at.  The citrus trees are lovely. It’s not the season for them right now, but very nice to have them scattered around the park. We enjoyed the spa and heated pool!! The drive to Disneyland was easy and quick.
Room tip: Pay extra for a premium spot for added room.

Summary: Nestled among actively producing citrus trees, this wonderful RV resort is by far my favorite on the two trips I’ve taken across the country. You pick your fruits right off the trees, your spaces are large and provide shade in the heat, fresh squeezed orange juice every morning in season!  Hot showers, a large, clean Laundry room, Helpful and extremely friendly staff!  20 minutes from disneyland.  Dog walking areas, RV washing areas, and lots more amenities, it’s just awesome all around!

Summary Heading: Oasis in the midst of city
Summary: We booked a deluxe site and so glad we did. Not only was it a pull-through site but we had extra space, grass, and a nice round table with umbrella and chairs. As others have said, there are citrus trees all over. You are encouraged to pick any fruit from your site or any vacant site with pickers in the store you can check out to reach the tops of the trees. Upon checking in, we received a goodie bag filled with useful items to include a pair of work gloves, mini flashlights and, my personal favorite, a Sudoku puzzle book! Our dog also received a goodie bag. It appears maintenance people are constantly working to keep the park looking good. You are told you can leave your plastic bags filled with trash outside your site and it will be picked up. Never heard of this before! I

We stayed at Orangeland because our 11 year old daughter needed brain surgery at CHOC, and it’s only a mile away from the hospital. We are from Bakersfield and needed a place that was family friendly (we have 6 kids!) and had all the amenities needed for us to have an extended stay. THE STAFF HERE IS AMAZING! Not only was everyone super kind to us, but the park is beautifully kept! I used the laundry room every other day we were here and it was not only convenient, but very clean. I can’t speak highly enough of the little and great kindnesses we were given while we were at Orangeland. I not only recommend this park to everyone, but we will make it our “home stop” every time we are in Orange County in our c class. Special shout out to Tim and all the kind ladies in their little

Summary Heading: Gem of an RV park in the city
Summary: Stayed here a week over New Years.   What a wonderfully kept RV Park!  Friendly staff, clean sites, a nice little shop, and orange trees throughout the park (and several on our site) that we were encouraged to pick and eat.   We used this park with our travel trailer as a base camp for Disneyland and it was very convenient and a nice alternative to the busy hotels.  It was also close to a lot of shopping and food.  We would definitely stay here again!

I think a fair number of the people are living here, but that didn't bother us. It's a quiet and tidy park.  We paid for a deluxe site and are glad we did. We got #43 and were pleased. It's a pull-thru and had more space between neighbors. Some of the other sections looked to be quite cramped.  It's true what everyone says that you can pick the oranges and other citrus. We picked oranges and grapefruit; both were plentiful and very yummy!  We went into old town Orange a couple times -- just a few minutes drive from the park. It's a charming place with plenty of restaurant options.
Manager Response: Thank you, Jeffrey. We appreciate your kind review of Orangeland RV Park and hope you will visit again soon. As a valued customer/guest, we look forward to taking care of your needs in the future. Until we see you, take care!

Summary: Had a great stay at this park. Check in was a breeze and was even escorted to the site. Lots of room to move a large rig safely through the park. Sites were a decent size and grass in between a nice touch in an urban stetting. park is very clean, well maintained and had several really nice conveniences such as a wash station and air compressor. Staff was super helpful and friendly. Highly recommend!
Manager Response: 262SteveR262, thank you for the great review and the recommendation. We appreciate you taking the time.

Summary: We have stayed here many times and it is always a good experience. There are always staff cleaning up the park and caring for the landscape.  Great location in the center of the OC. Lots of shade trees and restaurants and movie theater walking distance. I grew up here and moved a few yrs ago so this is a perfect place to stay when we are in town.
Manager Response: Happy to receive this review, Sightseer681084! Customer service is very important to us and your satisfaction is paramount. We appreciate your recommendation!

Summary: My husband and I stayed at Orangeland for 19 days in October. We paid for a pull through, and weren’t thrilled at how close we were to our neighbors. This was the tightest spot we’ve ever been put in. Instead of grass, we had mud right outside the steps with a tiny patch of brown grass. Thankfully I had a rug to put down or we would have mud all over our rig. They made it worse by watering the mud with loud sprinklers early morning. Speaking of noise, there is a big sports bar adjacent to the park and the noise and racing cars and motorcycles up and down the street at 2 am woke us up every night. The quiet hours are not observed as we had very loud neighbors sitting outside at midnight partying, it seemed like right next to my window. They also called us after two days and said
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a detailed review. In regards to the spacing of our lots, we firmly believe we have more than adequate spacing. The lots are separated by grass strips, which when watered, can turn to mud. As for the quiet hours you mentioned, there is a sports bar that does stay open until 2AM; unfortunately, we cannot dictate their noise level-- however, we do have security on site that all guests are given access to that are responsible for enforcing the quiet hours. The 2 dog limit per site is based on a city ordinance, regardless of the size of the dog. We do apologize for any miscommunication but we do make sure to advise our guests of this ordinance beforehand. The dog park is much bigger than 10 x 8 as you mentioned and the dog park is maintained on a daily basis with enzymes and other maintenance techniques. Finally, checkout to our sites is 11am and checkin does not begin until 1pm. The reason for the 2 hour gap is to clean and do any upkeep before our next guests arrive. Because of this, it is very likely that there appears to be openings but in reality, these lots are booked. Again, we do thank you for taking the time to leave this review, and should you wish to discuss further please don’t hesitate to contact us directly.

Summary Heading: 5 stars for friendliness, amenities and oranges!
Summary: This is a wonderful little RV park. I can’t tell you how glad we are to have chosen this property vs. others that were closer. From the moment we pulled in I got a positive vibe. From Sheriff Tim’s help pulling in, to friendly neighbors and all the amenities you’re looking for - this place is great. Seriously. Tidy, well kept. Only wish we got a chance to try the hot tub and pool (heated to 85 degrees!). Oh and it was nice and quiet - a huge plus. Plus a free goodie bag upon arrival. Not the closest to the parks, but honestly I bet the friendliest!
Manager Response: It was our absolute pleasure Zenlibrarian! Nothing makes us happier than getting great feedback like yours!

Summary: We needed a 2 week stay in the LA area and this was just what we wanted. We have 3 small kiddos and they were constantly entertained by everything the RV Resort has to offer. Mini golf, super clean swimming pool, shuffleboard, corn hole, pool table! (They have a covered playground also, but I believe it’s sand and I’m just not a fan of sand on playgrounds.) The bathrooms are spotless, the laundry room was spotless and you can use an app to pay to wash and dry your clothes. The staff was super helpful and very friendly. My kids also loved picking fruit from the trees. They recently stopped transportation to Disneyland, but it’s only a 10 minute drive to the parking garage. The parking garage is $25 a day... we did Disney 2 days and it was super easy to come back to the RV to rest
Manager Response: Thank you for the amazing review. We appreciate your feedback. We are so excited to hear about the positive experience you had with us. Thanks.

Summary: We stumbled across this RV resort accidentally, when looking for an overnight stop close to 5. This is the place to sleep if you attend an event at Honda Pavillion, if you want to visit Disneyland or go to OC beaches! It represents the more and more vanishing old fashioned RV parks. There is a dog wash station in one of the pet areas. The pool was popular with kids. The location is quiet, considering it is in Los Angeles close to everything. Lots of nice shade trees and of course all varieties of citrus trees.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. We appreciate your feedback. Thanks.

Summary Heading: First time in an RV Park
Summary: Place was really nice and everyone was very helpful. Great location with lots to do within a short drive. Pool on site with a nice little store. Showers and restrooms available. Very clean. Shuttle service available to Disneyland, reasonably priced ($3 round trip). WiFi available. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent feedback. We appreciate the awesome review and thankful you took the time to leave such a great rating. Thank you for sharing your insights.

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly, and close to Disney
Summary: We stopped here on the first leg of our 4 week summer trip with our 2 daughters. In short, we had a great time and would return.  Pros: -Very well kept -Everyone working here was nice -Pool and spa was clean and had a good space -30 min to Huntington Beach -10 min to Disneyland  -They let you pick fruit from their trees (Oranges and limes and maybe more) -Our spot had a good table with an umbrella
Manager Response: Thank you for the awesome review. We appreciate your feedback and excited to have provided such an excellent experience. Thank you for taking the time to leave some insights on your experience with us. Thanks.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here.  The spaces are large and have asphalt pads.  There are citrus trees throughout and we were able to pick delicious oranges at our site.  They have a nice pool, the showers were updated and there is a convenience store on site.  Angels Stadium and the Honda Center are within walking distance and Disney is a short shuttle ride away.  This is a great place to stay and we will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent feedback. We appreciate your business and excited to get such a great review. We are looking forward to your future visits. Thanks.

Summary Heading: We loved our time here!  It was an oasis in L.A.  They are also Tiny Home friendly!! :)
Summary: We stayed here for about a month in January/February and had a great time.  The park is clean, well kept, paved and close enough to Disneyland to make a short drive tolerable.  We stayed there with our (RVIA certified tiny home) and met many new friends because of it :)  The staff was fantastic.   I just can't say enough good about them.  We really want to go back there soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent feedback. We appreciate your business and excited to know you enjoyed your experience with us. Thanks.

Summary Heading: Beautiful RV park convenient to Disneyland
Summary: Citrus fruit trees are everywhere, and the fruit is free for picking if it's ripe! We called to make a last-minute reservation for this RV park and were so glad to have the experience! The park is clean and quiet and family-friendly. The restrooms were clean, and the front office staff were welcoming and helpful. And for first-time visitors like us, they give you a welcome kit with gloves, notepad, tiny lights, and other fun and useful things. Check the shuttle schedule and sign up to get a ride to Disneyland. The cost was reasonable, and it was cheaper and more convenient than parking at Disneyland. They have wifi, and they offer AAA or AARP discounts if you ask at the time of booking.
Manager Response: Thank you Christie for the awesome review. We appreciate the excellent feedback. We are excited to get such an awesome review. Thank you.

Summary: Many other parks are maintained beautifully, as is Orangeland.  Many offer amenities, but Orangeland has a gorgeous pool, unlimited fresh oranges and grapefruits from the many trees on property, Very well equipped laundry with several machines. Very nice people and a QUIET neighborhood location. We could not have been happier!
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent feedback. We appreciate your business and thankful for the kind words. We are so happy to hear how much of an awesome experience you had with us. Thanks again.

Summary Heading: This was a quick weekend visit to California Adventure with the grandkids
Summary: We arrived early and were able to check in and get set up.  We were very happy with the cleanliness of the facility and the friendliness of the staff.  Restrooms clean and well maintained.  Granddaughter enjoyed the playground.  They has someone lead us to our site and help us to back in.  Site was clean; had table & umbrella with 4 chairs.  We had a Premium Back in site  Even though we had full hook ups, hubby chose to try out the shower facilities.  Be sure to take shower shoes or some flip flops you can get wet.  Showers had mats that were quite tough on the feet.  They do have a shuttle available to the Parks.  Cost is $3 round trip per person, but does not accommodate anyone using a mobility device.  Small convenience type store.  Prices were not bad at all.  Trash pick up

Stayed two nights here and was impressed by the friendliness and cleanliness of the park.  The spots are all level, you can have some challenges with the slide-outs given the fruit trees on the property.  You can make it work, it just takes some positioning.  Our site guide, Sean, was very helpful. The trees are full of fruit and they welcome your picking.  While we didn't use the pool it did look inviting.  Having lived in OC, you cannot go wrong with this location for convenience to several key Freeways and Disney, Honda Center or Angel Stadium.  Additionally, if you feel the need, several excellent restaurants within a 5 minute walk.  Will be back.

This was our first trip with the RV. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Security directed escorted us to our site and helped us back in the trailer. The restrooms and grounds were very clean. They allow and encourage you to pick fruit from the citrus trees. Disneyland was about a 10 minute drive to the parking lot. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed on the 4th of July & if we didn’t have 2 small dogs with us, this would have been a 5. The gal in the office said we would hardly hear them, but we heard them quite loudly and they went on until midnight. The next night must’ve been from Disneyland because they stopped by 10pm. Otherwise, this is a great park with friendly staff. It seems like there are a lot of long term RVers here. On the 4th there was a fabulous BBQ and pool activities. As stated before you can pick oranges (they have fruit pickers in the office that you can check out. When we were there, there were a lot of green oranges on the bottom, but plenty of ripe ones higher up). I think these were Valencia’s because they made a great glass of juice. I bought a juicer for under $2.50 in the office. So sweet!

Summary Heading: Solid Hidden Gem in Orange County
Summary: Just really cool people and a great facility.  Make sure to get a premium or deluxe spot as they are nice with grass and orange trees.  Property is walking distance from Angels Stadium and free shuttle to Disneyland.  Priced nicely and discounts for veterans and Good Sam.

We stayed here while visiting Disney for a few days. My kids loved that we could pick a variety of fruit from the trees! The laundry, pool and playground were nice and well maintained.  Most of the staff were friendly to us during our stay. We would visit again!

Summary Heading: RV park in a beautifully well maintained Orange grove.
Summary: Very clean RV park in a beautiful citrus grove, oranges, lemons, grapefruit and limes.  All free for the picking, they even supply picking poles.  Well stocked store and gift shop, just minutes to Old Town Orange and Disneyland.

We just purchased a brand new travel trailer, and we chose Orangeland as our inaugural, first-ever camping trip. Orangeland has a very friendly, helpful staff, and the park is clean, well maintained, and fun. I highly recommend it - you won't be disappointed.

Stayed one night and arrived late. We left early for disneyland. It was a nice stay with a security assisting you to your spot and they have  goodies for us. No problems with hook ups. One of the best rv campgrounds we've stayed.

This park had a great feel, immediately upon driving in. All staff whom we encountered were professional, friendly and helpful, beginning with the office staff and the man who escorted us directly to our site. The park is well kept with great amenities, including a pool. Dotting the park are citrus trees throughout. The store is well stocked and the prices are excellent. It is a short, easy distance to Disneyland. This would have been a fun place to stay for a week or more!

This is my second visit to Orangeland RV Park.  The people who work here are very nice.  I stay here here because it’s close to my kids but it’s convenient to tourist attractions like Disneyland. In fact there is a shuttle that stops here and drops off at Disneyland although there is a small fee.   Lots of citrus trees in the park. All the oranges you can eat!

This was 1st stay at an rv park and we couldn't have asked for a more perfect place.  Everyone is so nice and helpful. Very well run and clean.  Shuttles to Disney.  Fruit trees galore and you are encouraged to pick the fruit. Will definitely come back.

Summary Heading: General assistance office is over there they have an age discrimination policy buyer beware
Summary: I planning on spending some time between Christmas and new years, but the response I got back was very upsetting, please see copy and.paste below so that I'm not accused of missing quoting.  Since your Mototorhome over 20 years old, we would need to have pictures. Our owner has said she doesn’t want any RV over 10years old in the park. But if it is in EXCELLENT condition we can sometimes waive that.  Please send pictures of the outside,  Ruann Orangeland RV Park  And for the record its a 99 Numar country star, so its not "over"twenty years old. Now it's old but in excellent operating condition, but it is weathered. If they are going to be this uppity, then I will go elsewhere
Manager Response: At Orangeland RV Park, we work hard to ensure our guests have a home away from home experience. Part of this involves community upkeep and appearance. This, after all, is a shared space. We’ve encountered issues with oil leakage, breakdowns etc. in the past, so to maintain a high standard for all our guests, we request images of older RVs. 99.9% of the time no one minds presenting these photos because they understand the standard Orangeland strives to achieve. We by no means age discriminate. The pictures are used to determine the quality of upkeep and appearance of the RV. No one wants to meet a broken-down RV in their reserved spot. We are willing and pleased to work with all of our guests to make sure they have the experience they paid for. We will certainly use this review to improve our services moving forward. Thank you.

Summary: The park is close to Anaheim Stadium, Honda Stadium and Anaheim Convention Center. Disneyland is 3 miles away. The RV spaces are nicely spaced and hookups well positioned. The park is clean, the restrooms and showers very clean. Although the park is in a residential/industrial area it is quiet and  little traffic noise, Easy access off the 57 Freeway, Newport Beach 20 minutes away.

Where do I start - from Wyoming & easy to reserve & get military discount - stayed 5 days - 4 nights & was amazing!!! From the simple shuttle to Disneyland for three days, to picking fresh oranges, lemons & other fruits in the trees, to the nice clean relaxing pool & showers & the assistance from park employees!!! Our space for our 32' class C RV was more than adequate & assistance with backing in from Larry was GREAT!! We rented a car one day from local Enterprise & they picked me up at My RV to get the car & brought me back to my RV after I turned in the car - to easy!! Also used Uber to take family to Baskin Robbins - pick up & wait & bring back to my RV was $7.30 - was a GREAT break from long days at Disneyland!! Will stay again & recommend without hesitation!!

Stayed for an overnightnighter to test my 2 year old granddaughter out in our trailer. We had a great time in such a short stay. The park is small. The people there are pleasant. It was our first trip there so we received a welcome bag upon check in. It had quite a few nifty items. They guide you to your spot and help you back in when you're ready. Full hookups make this park great. Site (89) was very clean as were the other spots in the park. Pool was fabulous and full of well behaved children. It wasn't crowded but very much enjoyed.  Store was stocked with just about anything you needed. There was a cute little play park my granddaughter loved. As far as convienience, this place is close to most Orange County amusements. Just mins from the Duck stadium and Angels Stadium as

This RV park is really wonderful. It is very clean. Staff is available all the time. They are very helpful. They have citrus trees throughout the park that you are encouraged to pick. You can check out a fruit picker stick to get to the high fruit. This is a big park and all sites are close together, but parking your rig is not hard. The pool is extremely clean. There is an exercise room with several nice machines. We were visiting friends not the abundance of entertainment and parks nearby. They have cable TV, and you check out a converter box to activate TV. Internet is not great. They have Tengo company internet which is slow (0,5 Megs or less), and it drops your connection often. This a higher priced park because of its location and the fact that this is a really nice park.

I've been here a few and I really like this RV park.  The staff at the front desk are great, however, this time, the little Latino guy on the golf cart disrespected us.  We don't have so much as a scratch on our unit as my husband was an RV salesman long before we bought our motorhome. That said, this maintenance man assumes we can't figure out how to back into a space, then screams orders at us about when to turn the wheel and so on, then he backed us right into a tree.  Thankfully, my husband stopped before any actual damage was done, but he did have to clean bits of bark off the siding.  To add insult to injury, he asked my husband why he stopped and told him to keep reversing more into the tree.  That was when my husband disregarded the man, and straightened the unit into

Summary Heading: One of the best campground I've stay at
Summary: Very clean love picking my own fruit.  very close to many attractions  .  nice size sites.  great place to take the family.I stay at many campgrounds all over the USA on of the best.  very quit and the rest rooms were kept spotless

This is a great RV park that is close to Disneyland and many other attractions in Orange County CA. You can take a shuttle to Disneyland or use Lyft or Uber. Short or long term stays. Clean showers and a nice laundry facility. Wifi service is not bad and included with your stay (Tengonet). Pick citrus fruit from the trees that are by almost every site.

We met some friends here that have been coming every winter for years. We stayed 5 nights. Walking distance to Honda Center where we saw a Ducks hockey game, walking distance to movie theater, lots of restaurants and a short drive to Disney Land. The RV park is clean, lots of amenities (swimming pool, laundry, hot tub, showers, mini store for a few supplies, citrus fruit trees to get fruit from). Our popup camper on our truck put us in a smaller space that backed to a bar, which was a bit noisy on game nights...but over all the white noise of the city all blended in. Overall it was super clean, staff was friendly and location was perfect.

Nice staff( Stuart and Larry), family atmosphere, bathrooms are officially open 24 hrs. Super shower pressure. Very quiet. Enjoyed the large heated pool and tub many times.  Many great citrus fruits to eat. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Ideal location for a visit to Disneyland and surrounding attractions. Wide, paved sites nestled among fruit trees. (Guests are encouraged to pick fresh oranges, grapefruits, tangerines, and lemons from the trees, or help themselves to fruit that has been picked and available in baskets at the office door.) Very friendly and accommodating office staff. Well-equipped office store. Nice pool...temperature good for swimming laps. Easy access to freeways and rail station.

I have nothing to complain about here at all! We chose this park over other nearby parks because they allow 8 people on a site and two cars at no extra charge. We had family join us in our RV and they had a rental car so the weekly good sams rate was $425 which I found to be very affordable for the proximity to Disneyland. There was a shuttle available but we all drove the 10 mins in one vehicle and it was cheaper to pay for parking then the shuttle for us all.  We loved the ability to pick ripe citrus from the trees in the park. The pool was warm enough for the kids to go swimming even on cool days.  The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The laundry was clean and affordable. The numerous restrooms were very clean and well maintained. We were able to have packages delivered.

Booked this location for a weeklong stay and we were not disappointed.  Great service, clean park, nice pool and hot tub and plenty of variety of citrus to pick.  Laundry facilities were clean.  Showers were clean and nice.  Would not hesitate to stay here again.  Great job Orangeland!

Summary Heading: Always a nice park for a Southern California visit
Summary: The park is clean and nicely maintained. Quiet location. The best part is the friendly staff. This is usually a fairly busy park, but the staff keep everything in order. They have good processes to keep it all running smoothly. This is my 3rd or 4th visit over the years and I have never been disappointed. I lived in the area for 21 years, so I'm not usually doing tourist activities. But I find the park to have a great central location to anything that the family is doing.

Great RV park for visitors.  Nice, fully stocked little store onsite (even some inexpensive Disney stuff along with RV necessities, travel necessities and food).  Super clean restrooms. Friendly staff. Pet friendly in that there are small pebble dog areas (one with a dog bath). Easy walk to Starbucks, Subway sandwiches, Movies, nice restaurants. Shuttle to Disneyland. Pay for an upgraded spot with grass/tree if there during the day. Seems safe all over the park but ask to see what's available as each location (and neighbors / street etc) vary.

We spent four days here while on a family vacation at Disneyland. We were in a deluxe spot with a nice patio and there were enough trees and shade that we didn't need to put the awning out on the travel trailer. It was about a ten minute drive to Disney, we did not use the shuttle instead we opted to drive our own vehicle each day. The park is clean and well maintained and the staff was very courteous. Our teenage grandson complained about very slow internet, but we liked the quiet, peaceful ambiance of this RV park.

We have spent a week here almost every fall for about 15 years. Lovely trees, patios,  fenced dog run. Level paved pads. Orange and lime trees throughout the park. Pick the fruit right off the trees. Extremely clean and well maintained.  Only 10 minutes from Disneyland. A bit spend your but is your best bet if you want to stay near Anaheim.  Don't forget to ask for a cable box,  the cable TV won't work without it.

This is a very nice resort with a great location to many attractions. The park is very clean and well kept up. The only negative was poor internet service. Pool and spa well maintained and children are not amy issue to others.

This RV park is very nice well maintained geared mainly for full timers but also good for families. Only draw back is it's a little bit far from Disneyland and has a private shuttle bus that you must work around his difficult changing schedule. Great place to be unless you are going to Disneyland I would not go back. The other two campsites are also nice and are much easier with multiple shuttle buses

Summary Heading: Strange policies = one and only visit to Orangeland
Summary: We just returned from a wonderful visit to SoCal, including a full week a Disneyland Resort. We have a family of 5, including our 3 kids, aged 10, 6, and 2. Disneyland was wonderful!... Our RV stay at Orangeland had potential, but fell flat on its face for a number of reasons.  We stayed at a number of RV parks on our vacation. Orangeland was our longest stay (7 nights), as it was our Disneyland stop on our trip.  Our first impression of Orangeland was pretty good. All the ripe oranges made the kids very excited, the pool and playground looked inviting, and the staff was pleasant. The place seemed to be fairly family friendly.  The facilities are ok. Nice sized laundry facility (although some washers are smelly and need to be avoided), good bathrooms/showers, and a "heated" pool

The staff at Orangeland RV park went above and beyond for us during our stay. From the front desk staff to the maintenance staff they are all amazing and friendly and super helpful.  The grounds are impeccable and the amenities are great.  Kids had a great time picking the various types of oranges, grape fruits, and lemon and limes.  We enjoyed it so much we came back for another 3 days in January before heading home. Will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Great Location, LEt them eat Oranges
Summary: Super nice park. Would return again, reasonable price, not too far from Disney.  I have a 42' and they can handle that size plus larger. Fruit trees all over, for nice fresh fruit. We went Christmas week, Nice weather.

We were thinking of booking here but the washrooms close at 10:30 pm!  We have a tent trailer so we need use of the washrooms. They would be closed by the time we got back from Disney at night and goodness, what if we needed to pee during the night?  Other RV sites near by give you a washroom key to keep upon check in to use when the washrooms close. I was also a bit put off by the fact that they only accept RV's under 10 years old.  Ours is, but I thought that was a very snobby policy to have. Only the well to do are allowed to camp there apparently.  I just thought I should let others know so that they aren't surprised when they come back from Disney and can't take a shower before bed.

We spent the night at this campground while visiting a friend at Chapman University. For being so close to the city, this is an outstanding campground.  All of the sites are paved and have many fruit trees to provide privacy. One thing I loved was the ability to pick oranges, lemons or grapefruit from the trees.  The bathrooms were well-maintained and the showers good and hot.  The staff that we ran into were also very professional and pleasant to work with.

We spent two nights at Orangeland RV Park. Check in is easy. You're guided to your space and given a nice gift bag (one for the dog too!). We were able to walk to dinner at JT Schmidt's Brewery and it's nicely located for a variety of outings. Most folks stay to go to Disneyland, they offer a shuttle, but we had other plans.  The park is very clean, they have trash pick up at your curb, and a nice store, and tons of citrus trees. You're allowed to pick the fruit from any tree. They have two dog areas which are well stocked with bags however I wouldn't say the park is dog friendly. The dog areas are small and there are signs and reminders everywhere it's a crime in Orange if a dog wets the bushes. I suppose that's due to irresponsible owners but we've never stayed anywhere where

I haven't been back to this lovey campground since 2005 for the World Badminton Championships at the APOA (Arrowhead Pond of Anaheim) fondly known as the 'Pond'. The deal was, you provide the RV and well p/u the tab for the campground and admission to the tournament.  I jumped on the deal because it seemed fair and there was competitive Badminton on the other end. Were hooked on the sport but this was to watch international talent that are up and comers playing here. The event at the Orange County Badminton Center was also in close proximity. Which is why we chose this place as well as prior experience.  Orangeland RV Park is situated ideally for visitors to Disneyland or those to Badmintonland or anywhere in between. Clean, comfortable, convenient and offering plenty of

My family and i thank the good Lord for blessing us with Orangeland rv park. we stayed at Anaheim RV park for one night and about lost our minds... then God showed us Orangeland and we loved the week we stayed. the best staff you could ask for, swimming pool top notch, and some of the very best restrooms. My daughter and i picked fresh oranges every morning and sometimes grapefruit and lemons! It was just as many good memories for my family as the time we spent down the road at Disney! I would HIGHLY recommend this park!

Husband and I born and raised in Orange County, had no idea this park existed. Stayed for a weekend as we had multiple things to do in OC and live in Riverside. The check in staff was wonderful! (Came out to help my husband back in). Spots are a little close together, however, there is a charming table with umbrella at each site, and grass and orange trees throughout park. Very close to Angel stadium- Saturday night fireworks were spectacular! Price was acceptable for a very nice park (no cable but WIFI was better than in most parks that I have stayed in). We will be back!

My partner and I stayed here for 9 nights in our RV and while we were out doing lots of things, we also spent a couple of rest days just relaxing in the pool and the spa! It was so great after a long day out to come 'home' and be able to switch off and be in relax mode within minutes. Not only were the facilities fantastic, it was close to public transport to LA and they even run a shuttle bus to Disneyland for a $3 return trip - bargain!! We honestly had the best time at Orangeland and would recommend it to everyone! The staff were amazing and answered so many questions, even showing us some things to do around the area. Great laundry facilities too. They even run night time activities (Poker, Bingo, etc.) and even put on a breakfast on the weekend we were there - just

Stayed here on a family trip to Disneyland.  The park overall is very nice.  Well maintained with friendly staff.  Our site was a little small and tightly packed.  I would personally prefer a bit more grass in the sites. But the wifi was really good, the pool was great.  The store has tons of items and the Orange trees that are planted everywhere were really nice.

When we arrived in California for what was to be a several months-long job,  we weren't sure what to expect.  We booked reservations at Orangeland and fell in love almost instantly. The staff is so nice,  the grounds are meticulously maintained,  the facilities are always clean, neighbors are considerate -- it truly is a gem. We were so sad to leave,  but have wonderful memories!

Park is well located for greater LA close to Disney and Sport Stadii and walking distance to a few restaurants. Friendly staff, decent size spots with some shade. Nice clean facilities and pool and a good size laundry. They also take recycle which we like. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I think the row at the back of the park past the laundry is longer term residents. Overall a nice quiet park.

We love a warm welcome, it make the stay so much nice. We were greeted her by folk who acted as if they were genuinely glad we were staying with them. The park is great. It’s close to the freeway, but you can’t hear it. The roads are all paved as are the sites. And there are lots and lots of citrus trees. You’re free to pick ripe fruit from your tree or from the trees of any empty sites. They even give you the basket-on-a-stick tool to help you reach the fruit at the top. They even have a little map telling you which trees are what kind of fruit and when they become ripe.  	They have tons of amenities: store, club room, billiard room, exercise room, heated pool, Jacuzzi, showers, playground, full sized laundry room and so on and so on. We especially appreciate that they have

Very nice place to stay. They are very organized and have a large ofice with a small store that has almost everything. Grounds are well manicured.Have all amenities you will need. They even have trash curbside pickup.  RV spots are level but very close together. Not an issue if you are gone most of the time. Nice table and chairs with umbrella. Water pressure is high so have a regulator. Nice pool and spa.  I would recommend this place

Orangeland is a nice park with friendly staff at a great location. We wanted to stay close to Disneyland and this was, but we also drove into Los Angeles in reasonable time.  Spots are tight, but they have a pool, hot tub, playground, clubhouse with computers, tv, games, etc., laundry, store, and small putt putt green.  Prices are comparable for the area.  There do seem to be some permanently residents, though, so if that is bothersome to you I would recommend finding somewhere else to stay.

Location location location.  Walk to see a concert or the Anahiem Ducks play at the Honda center...or walk to see the Angels play at Angels Stadium.  Walk to movie theaters, restaurants and pubs.  Within five minutes drive of Disneyland, the mall of Orange and ten or so minutes of great beaches!  The location is easily accessible for RVs with easy access to I5, I55, I57, I91....   Close to Knotts Berry farm.  Los Angeles, Hollywood, Universal Studios.... The location cannot be overstated.   Facilities include A huge, clean pool and hottub. Large putting green.  Full size shuffleboard court.  Pool table.  Workout room.  Clean and modern bathroom and showers. On site modern laundry facilities.  Great shaded playground.  Dog walk area.  Barbecue/picknick area.  Full service store

We've stayed at this park many times. Prices are good RV sites are small but clean and full hookups. We had a voltage problem in our site and I reported it and they had electricians fix it right away. Shuttle to Disneyland is very reasonably priced and very convenient. The entire park has orange and lemon trees and you can pick the fruit when in season.

What a nice place to stay! 5 Star RV park.  We made a trip, Dec 24th thru 29th 2014.  The staff was very accommodating, facilities were great, and you get free citrus fruit as much as you like. Such a deal.  About 10 min from Disney via cab. We will return when in that area again.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you have an RV
Summary: what a nice place to stay in the Disneyland area. We rented an RV and stayed for a week. The facilities were clean and the staff was very helpful. By the time we left were on a first name basis with a lot of the staff. The orange trees were so nice all over the park. I would love to stay there again but with a much nicer RV. Lol

We stayed 3 nights while we visited Disneyland. It's a pretty nice park. I liked that it was quiet. It's not located on a very busy road, more of a business/residential area so now speeding cars blasting by at all hours of the day and night. The fruit trees were filled with oranges but they were all still green so we didn't get to pick any :( But if you go when they're ripe, it would be a wonderful perk to have right on your site.   The showers were pretty clean with nice space and enough hot water and pressure. Our spot was a little tight to back into but once in it was ok. Pretty close to each other but with all of the trees helped give a feeling of privacy. I did walk the dogs around the park and if we ever stay again will choose sites in the 50s on the other side. They

Summary Heading: Nice Park - great staff - a bit pricey
Summary: We stayed 4 nights in October.  The park is clean and well maintained - staff friendly during entire stay.  Sites are nice sized and some have grass and tables.  There are a lot of permanent residents, but most of their sites are well cared for.  They do have a nice pool as well as nice restroom facilities.  There is a well stocked store on site.  Many fruit trees on site and they invite you to pick as many as you like.  This park is centrally located near Angel Stadium, The Pond, Disneyland and other So Cal attractions.    My only complaint is that they are a bit pricey - even with a Good Sam or AAA rate, price was over the $75 per nite rate.....but if you don't mind paying for location, this is a good park.  They do have a two dog limit and have some strict dog walking rules.

Summary Heading: A very nice park near a bunch of attractions
Summary: We stayed at this park for two days in early October, 2014. The park staff was very friendly and helpful. The park and it's facilities were very clean. The park is located near Disneyland and many nice restaurants and attractions. It has two dog runs, one with a doggy wash. A heated pool and spa add to the enjoyment

The RV Park was beautifully maintained.  The staff was very pleasant, helpful and efficient.  It is centrally located to all of Orange County's recreation and amusement activities.  The park has a very "safe" feeling about it.

We chose this park to be close to lax and to allow us to drop off our RV. When you get over the fact it's in the middle of a trading estate you are welcomed by super friendly staff. The pool was clean, the spa hot and the park was full of lemon and lime trees which were great for our gin and tonics. The laundry facilities were super and very cheap so I did a couple of wash and drys on the morning we went home. Thanks Orangeland RV Park The Dunns from England

This is a very nice park. Very clean and staff is great. They help you set up and include a welcome bag when you check in. The park is close to Disneyland & Knott's Berry Farm and a large theater and restaurant complex is an easy walk from the park.

Helpful friendly staff, we arrived right at closing time, they checked us in and staff escorted to our site and assisted in parking and setting up the RV. The park is manicured and maintained, although the RV spaces are small.? The rest rooms and showers are clean and modern. Orange trees are scattered throughout the park and they encourage picking them. The park is located less than a mile from Disneyland. The prices are reasonable with several discounts available. Definitely a place to return for a visit

Nice place, nice staff! It is a 5 minute shuttle to Disneyland, but not a big deal at all. Very clean. RV spots for short term stays are right up front in the best part of the park. Great BBQ area! Nice touch with the fruit trees!

We stay here a couple times a year. We like it because it's not the mega KOA in Pamona filled with rental RV's and unfriendly people.  And it's not just a parking lot like some of the other area rv parks.   Most all the trees are citrus.  There for guests to pick at will. We keep a citrus juicer in the rv just for Orangeland.  We have fresh OJ every morning.   Staff are very nice. They all seem it be full timers here in the park. Have great pride in keeping the place nice and being helpful.   Prices are a little high, but they don't nickel and dime you. We like to stay in the premium spots with patio furniture and umbrella. Also extra spot to park a car.   They have pool table, shuffle board, swimming pool, covered playground, and a nice BBQ area with stainless steel grills.

I stayed here a few months ago and I have to say that this place is way too expensive for how the place looks!  There are junky sites everywhere and noisy people.  To pay what I paid to stay there which was over $1000, I had to look at junk, hear yappy noisy dogs in the 2 sites behind us, hammering metal by the same people behind us and then at night they would be out laughing and talking really loud.  I would not stay in the sites 44-48 because the noisy people and their yappy noisy dogs stay in the sites that back up to those sites and the junkiest site is in front of sites 44-48.

Summary Heading: Great RV park close to Disneyland!
Summary: We stay at Orangeland every summer when we travel to Disneyland from canada! Minutes from Disneyland and you can walk to the angels games and circus! The pool is fantastic and you are away from the chaotic crowds of anaheim and the Disney strip on harbour boulevard.  Staff is warm and friendly and they can accommodate pretty much all size RVs.
